analysis.Summary: Vue 3 component that renders an event hero section with a full-screen background image or video, an overlay gradient, and logic to auto-play/pause the video.
analysis.Purpose: Provide a reusable hero/banner section for events, displaying either a cover image or looping background video based on provided props.

Components.name: HeroEvent
Components.description: Root Vue component wrapping a <section> that shows an image or video background, overlay layers, and container for title/text (empty in this snippet).

Functions.name: checkAndPlayVideo
Functions.description: Attaches event handlers to the video element to track play/pause state.

Functions.name: getVideoType
Functions.description: Determines the MIME type for the video source based on its file extension.

Functions.name: playVid
Functions.description: Attempts to play the video if it is paused and not already playing.

analysis.Usage: Import HeroEvent.vue into parent pages or layout components. Pass in a `content` prop with `cover` or `video` URL and an `options` prop containing at least a `date` field.
Notes: Uses `<script setup>` syntax and `scoped` SCSS for styling.
Computes `timeDifference` from `options.date` and current time, but it's not used in this snippet.
Imports `useI18n` but does not use it; could be leftover or for future localization.
The `playsinlineclass playsinline` attribute on <video> looks like a typo and may require correction.
Overlay gradient class `.bg-white-overlay` provides a fade from opaque white to transparent.
